intro: Dortmanna subcuneata, commonly known as the narrow-angled Dortmanna, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and woodland edges. Its leaves are lanceolate, with a distinctive subcuneate base, and it produces small, white to greenish flowers. It is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments and is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
